topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bffb076368725ac7d50200#post_54bffb076368725ac7d50200
[bq="Number1pegasus"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bffa7c6368722cd4fd0b00#post_54bffa7c6368722cd4fd0b00
I didn't even watch that, but EVERYONE talks about that shit.

Like, WHY.[/bq]
The reason why everyone gets pissed off by the ending is that he chooses to date his sister and rejects the other girls that like him. . . but then the last five minutes they both go "lol jk" and turns out that they were only pretending to be a couple for fuck all reason and nobody winds up with anyone.  The entire show was a colossal waste of time cause every episode except the first and last episode doesn't matter; it would be like if you watched a entire show and it turns out everything except the first and last episode was complete and utter filler.

Both the pro-incest and anti-incest sides universally agreed that the ending sucked.  It's one of those shows that the ending legitimately makes everyone angry.
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bffb6f636872267ec50c00#post_54bffb6f636872267ec50c00
[bq="SquiggyBomb"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bffa7c6368722cd4fd0b00#post_54bffa7c6368722cd4fd0b00
Oh god that weird incest manga...
What is Japan's fascination with incest?[/bq]
*BURSTS THROUGH CEILING*
*Cheesy 60's style synth music with people singing physics equations in latin in the background*
SCIENCE-MAN TO THE RESCUE!
Actually it's not just Japan; incest is actually really common and on average one out of five people will have a romantic relationship with a relative in their lifetime.  Also 10% of people worldwide marry someone in their immediate family; most of these are first or second cousin marriages, but you get the point.
SCIENCE-MAN AWAY!
*BURSTS THROUGH YOUR ROOF AND MAKES ANOTHER HOLE IN YOUR ROOF!*
